p: The reducing powers of pomegranate leaves and peels, fig leaves, guava leaves and olive leaves crude juices were accomplished as described by Ayoub et al. [ 12]. The absorbance was recorded at 700 nm in a UV–vis spectrophotometer (Shimadzu, UVmini-1240, Japan). Ascorbic acid was used as a standard and phosphate buffer as a blank solution. The antioxidant activity of the crude juice was expressed as IC 50 and compared with standard. All measurements were accomplished in triplicate.
